title: Trannie Anderson Talks Revealing More of Her Heart on ‚ÄòHeart Like a Songwriter‚Äô & Picking ‚ÄòSongs That Introduce Who I¬†Am‚Äô
summary: Grammy nominee Trannie Anderson is set to release her songwriting project and make her Grand Ole Opry debut.
body: Songwriter Trannie Anderson was driving to go deer hunting when she found out she‚Äôd landed her first Grammy nomination, earning a nod for best country song for Lainey Wilson‚Äôs ‚ÄúSomewhere Over Laredo,‚Äù which Wilson wrote with Anderson, Andy Albert and Dallas Wilson. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt really have any [cell] reception,‚Äù Anderson recalls to Billboard . ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt even get the live stream to work. Lainey texted us and I legitimately had to pull over to the side of the road and I was just sobbing. It was very special. It was bigger than I dreamed‚Äîand I got a deer that weekend, too, so it was pretty much the best weekend, ever.‚Äù Anderson has co-written nearly a dozen songs that have populated Lainey‚Äôs two CMA album of the year-winners Bell Bottom Country and Whirlwind , including the Country Airplay No. 1 ‚ÄúSomewhere Over Laredo‚Äù and top 5 hits ‚ÄúHeart Like a Truck,‚Äù and ‚ÄúWildflowers and Wild Horses.‚Äù Cole Swindell, Gabby Barrett, Madeline Edwards and Nate Smith have also recorded her songs. Anderson highlights a wider scope of her songwriting range on her full-fledged songwriter project, Heart Like a Songwriter , out Friday (Jan. 16). Heart Like a Songwriter blends poems and music, including And‚Ä¶

title: ‚ÄòHeated Rivalry‚Äô Won‚Äôt Generate Any Heat at This Year‚Äôs Primetime Emmys. Here‚Äôs¬†Why.
body: Heated Rivalry is one of the most buzzed-about TV miniseries in recent years, a true phenomenon that has crossed over beyond what anyone might have thought possible for a gay love story. Related ‘Heated Rivalry’ Is Getting an Official Soundtrack ‚Äî and It’s Coming Sooner Than You Think ‘Heated Rivalry’ Synchs Lead to Big Gains for Feist, Wolf Parade, Wet Leg & More Indie Favorites How ‚ÄòHeated Rivalry‚Äô Episode 4‚Äôs Viral ‚ÄòAll the Things She Said‚Äô Needle Drop Came Together: ‚ÄòInstead of Tripping Out at the Club, You‚Äôre Lusting Out‚Äô So, it‚Äôs natural to start thinking about the show‚Äôs Primetime Emmy potential. Let‚Äôs see, there could be acting nominations chatter about Hudson Williams (who plays Canadian Shane Hollander) and Connor Storie (who plays Russian Ilya Rozanov). And there could be nods in music categories for the show‚Äôs lead composer Peter Peter and/or the many artists who contributed songs to the miniseries. We might as well call a halt to all this conjecture right here, because the program won‚Äôt be eligible for the Primetime Emmys. title: Billboard‚Äôs Music Industry Events¬†Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. title: Caf√© Tacvba Reflects on Its Request to Remove Its Music From Spotify: ‚ÄòThis Process is Long, Tedious,¬†Heavy‚Äô
summary: Vocalist Rub√©n Albarr√°n talks to Billboard Espa√±ol in Mexico City.
body: Amid a hiatus that the Mexican band Caf√© Tacvba began at the end of 2024, vocalist Rub√©n Albarr√°n reappeared last week (Jan. 7) on social media to publicly make a request on behalf of the group to its former record labels, Universal Music and Warner Music Mexico: to remove their catalog from Spotify , arguing that the platform “contravenes their artistic principles.” The request from the famous rock quartet, also composed of Emmanuel del Real (keyboards), Joselo Rangel (guitar), and Quique Rangel (bass) ‚Äî an unprecedented move in the Latin American music scene until then ‚Äî refers to ethical concerns over “reprehensible” actions by the streaming company, such as investments in weaponry and propaganda for the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency, and questions the royalty distribution model and the use of AI. Related Caf√© Tacvba Asks Former Labels to Remove the Band’s Music From Spotify, Citing Ethical Concerns Over ICE’s Campaign, Use of AI & More Spotify Confirms U.S. Price Hike for Premium Plans Starting Soon Olivia Dean & Little Simz Lead Nominees for 2026 MOBO Awards: Full List ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time to raise our voices‚Ä¶

title: Jelly Roll, Alejandro Sanz & Grupo Frontera to Headline Car√≠n Le√≥n‚Äôs La Cura¬†Fest
summary: Le√≥n announced his first guests for the two-day event, which will take place in his hometown of Hermosillo, M√©xico.
body: La Cura Fest by Car√≠n Le√≥n will take place for the first time in March, and the Mexican music star announced his first guests on Thursday (Jan. 15). These include Spanish pop star Alejandro Sanz , Mexican music idols Grupo Frontera and country singer and rapper Jelly Roll as headliners, reflecting Le√≥n‚Äôs eclectic musical tastes and versatility. The lineup also features Puerto Rican singer-songwriter Kany Garc√≠a , Mexican singer-songwriter Kevin Kaarl and country band Midland , with more artists to be announced in the coming weeks. The event will be held on Saturday, March 14, and Sunday, March 15, at the Expogan in the Mexican city of Hermosillo, Sonora, Le√≥n‚Äôs hometown. The lineup, in this first phase, includes colleagues and friends of the ‚ÄúLa Primera Cita” singer, many of whom he has collaborated with throughout his career. With Sanz, for instance, Le√≥n recorded hits such as “El Vino de Tu Boca” and “Mil Motivos”; with Garc√≠a, “Te Lo Agradezco”; and with Grupo Frontera, “Que Vuelvas” and “Mutuo.” In addition to the main stage at the Expogan (Expo Ganadera), there will also be a secondary stage at the venue’‚Ä¶

title: Clouds Swimming over Lago Argentino
summary: A collection of fish-shaped clouds hovered above the glacial lake in Patagonia in December 2025.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Clouds Swimming over Lago‚Ä¶ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe üõú RSS Contact Us Search December 27, 2025 When an astronaut aboard the International Space Station snapped this photograph of Lago Argentino in Patagonia on December 27, 2025, a school of fish-shaped clouds lingered over the glacial lake‚Äôs teal waters. Determining the clouds‚Äô type and origin from the photograph alone is challenging, but several NASA scientists and university researchers offered a theory after reviewing the image. ‚ÄúThe lens shape reminds me of lenticular clouds , which usually form near or over mountains,‚Äù said Maria Hakuba, a research scientist in the aerosols and clouds group at NASA‚Äôs Jet Propulsion Laboratory. ‚ÄúThe edges of the cloud also look quite smooth rather than ‚Äòfuzzy,‚Äô which suggests they‚Äôre ice‚Ä¶
